author: Roberta Souza
title: Pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o entra em aÃ§Ã£o nessa sexta e agora podemos dar tchau para o QR Code! Veja como funciona e quem pode usar a nova ferramenta
text:
Nova funÃ§Ã£o super aguardada permite pagamentos sem abrir o App do banco! Confira como vai funcionar o pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o
A partir da prÃ³xima sexta-feira (28), os brasileiros poderÃ£o usar o Pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o, tornando os pagamentos ainda mais rÃ¡pidos e prÃ¡ticos! Agora, serÃ¡ possÃ­vel realizar transferÃªncias apenas encostando o celular na maquininha, assim como jÃ¡ acontece com cartÃµes de crÃ©dito e dÃ©bito, de acordo com o site CNN.
A novidade elimina a necessidade de acessar o aplicativo do banco para realizar a transaÃ§Ã£o, tornando o processo mais Ã¡gil e eficiente.
Como funciona o pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o?
âœ”ï¸ O usuÃ¡rio deve adicionar o Pix Ã  carteira digital do celular (Google Pay, Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, entre outras).
âœ”ï¸ No momento do pagamento, basta aproximar o celular da maquininha, revisar os detalhes da transaÃ§Ã£o e confirmar.
âœ”ï¸ O valor mÃ¡ximo permitido serÃ¡ de R$ 500 por operaÃ§Ã£o, mas o usuÃ¡rio pode configurar limites menores ou diÃ¡rios.
âœ”ï¸ Bancos, carteiras digitais e maquininhas nÃ£o sÃ£o obrigados a oferecer a funcionalidade, entÃ£o Ã© importante verificar com sua instituiÃ§Ã£o financeira.
O pix tradicional vai acabar?
NÃ£o! O Pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o Ã© apenas uma opÃ§Ã£o extra. As formas tradicionais de pagamento via chave Pix e QR Code continuarÃ£o existindo normalmente.
ðŸ”¹ No primeiro momento, a funÃ§Ã£o estarÃ¡ disponÃ­vel apenas para dispositivos Android e usuÃ¡rios de bancos que participam do Open Finance.
ðŸ”¹ O projeto comeÃ§ou a ser testado em outubro de 2023 em algumas lojas de BrasÃ­lia e SÃ£o Paulo. Agora, a funcionalidade comeÃ§a a ser expandida para todo o Brasil.
Vantagens do pix por aproximaÃ§Ã£o
âœ… Mais rapidez: NÃ£o precisa abrir o aplicativo do banco.
âœ… Mais praticidade: Funciona como um cartÃ£o por aproximaÃ§Ã£o.
âœ… Mais seguranÃ§a: TransaÃ§Ã£o protegida por autenticaÃ§Ã£o do celular.

author: Steve DelVecchio
title: Lions getting star player back for playoff game against Commanders
text:
Lions getting star player back for playoff game against Commanders
The Detroit Lions are officially getting one of their best players back for their Divisional Round playoff game.
David Montgomery has been removed from the injury report ahead of Saturday nightâ€™s game against the Washington Commanders. The star running back missed the final three games of the regular season, but he is in line to return for the biggest matchup of the year.
The Lions did not have to play in the Wild Card round, as they defeated the Minnesota Vikings in Week 18 to capture the NFC North title and No. 1 seed in the NFC. That extra time off was likely key in Montgomeryâ€™s recovery from a knee injury.
Montgomery was initially reported to have torn his MCL in the Lionsâ€™ Dec. 15 loss to the Buffalo Bills. The injury was expected to end his season, but he sought multiple opinions and was able to avoid surgery.
Montgomery finished the regular season with 775 rushing yards and 12 touchdowns. The Lions rely heavily on him and backfield mate Jahmyr Gibbs, which is why the tandem has an awesome nickname.
With Montgomery now back in the mix, Detroit will likely lean on their two-headed monster on Saturday. The Commanders allowed 137.5 rushing yards per game during the regular season, which was the third-worst mark in the NFL.

author: @KNOE8
title: SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH Now In Effect For Portions of the ArkLaMiss: Updated Timeline & Threats
text: SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH Now In Effect For Portions of the ArkLaMiss: Updated Timeline & Threats with Meteorologist Jake Lambright MONROE, La. (KNOE) - A Severe Thunderstorm Watch is now in effect until 11 p.m. for the counties and parishes shaded in pink in the graphic below. Stay weather aware! Even if your county or parish is not under the watch at this time, it is still important to remain weather aware this evening. My full update is below. The Storm Prediction Center continues to include most of the ArkLaMiss in an ENHANCED RISK (level 3 of 5) for strong to severe storms in their afternoon update. The primary threats for this evening continue to be damaging winds and large hail; however, a tornado or two cannot be entirely ruled out. We will have to keep a close eye on storm activity from 7:00 p.m. Thursday through 1:00 a.m. early Friday morning. As of now, storms are expected to move quickly through our region. Below you can find the latest Futurecast and severe weather outlook. Make sure to share this with friends and family that live in the ArkLaMiss! We have shorter videos published to both Facebook and Instagram, which are linked below. Instagram Update (< 70 seconds): [https://www.instagram.com/reel/C6uqM6dppbH/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==](https://www.instagram.com/reel/C6uqM6dppbH/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==) SEVERE WEATHER OUTLOOK: TIMELINE: Isolated showers and storms will begin moving into the ArkLaMiss around 10 p.m. These storms are expected to form a line within a few hours. These storms will continue to move through the region through the 11 p.m. hour. The strongest of these storms will be capable of producing damaging wind gusts in excess of 75 mph and hail up to hen egg size (2.0 inches in diameter). With the moderate to high amount of energy that storms will have to work with, these will likely maintain their strength for at least an hour or two after midnight. Storms finally begin to move out close to 1 a.m. Your Friday morning commute will be clear! Above is a summary of potential storm impacts. Your Weather Authority team will be monitoring the storm threat throughout the day on Thursday. We will provide you with further updates as they become available. Make sure that you are following us on Facebook and have the KNOE Weather app installed on your favorite device! Copyright 2024 KNOE. All rights reserved.

title: Errani e Vavassori che storia | agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana
text: Fonte : sport.quotidiano di 5 set 2024 Errani e Vavassori che storia | agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana Errani e Vavassori, che storia: agli Us Open il primo Slam di una coppia tutta italiana (Di giovedÃƒÂ¬ 5 settembre 2024) New York, 5 settembre 2024 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Sorrisi quando lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢altro sb agli a, testatine amichevoli e urli dÃ¢â‚¬â„¢esultanza dritti in faccia. Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori alzano la coppa degli Us Open , ridefinendo il concetto di complicitÃƒ . La coppia partita da Wimbledon con lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢idea di assaltare le Olimpiadi riscrive invece la storia Slam del doppio misto azzurro. Nessuno come loro, nellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢anno in cui i piÃƒÂ¹ bei record dellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Italtennis si sono sgretolati. Si giocava pure contro il campo, con il pubblico a sostenere Donald Young (ultima partita prima del ritiro per dedicarsi al Pickleball) e Taylor Townsend, regolati 7-6, 7-5. Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori vincono il doppio misto agli US Open, prima coppia tutta italiana in uno Slam! - Sul 3-3 Young tira due passanti di dritto che portano al deciding point sul servizio del torinese. In qualche modo lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ottavo game arriva anchÃ¢â‚¬â„¢esso al deciding point, ma Townsend riesce a giocare lo smash su Vavassori per il 4-4. Oggi arriva unÃ¢â‚¬â„¢altra ciliegina sulla torta per unÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Italia che al momento assomma sette finali Slam nel 2024 (e potrebbe non essere finita qui). oasport Errani-Vavassori nella storia, vincono Us Open doppio misto - 7-6 7-5 il punteggio a favore degli azzurri. Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori scrivono la storia del tennis italiano. Nella finale del doppio misto degli Us Open giocata sull'Arthur Ashe, hanno sconfitto la coppia americana Taylor Townsend e Donald Young diventando la prima coppia italiana di sempre a conquistare uno Slam in questa categoria del tennis. quotidiano Errani e Vavassori scrivono la storia del tennis italiano: vittoria nel doppio misto agli Us Open - Il match, caratterizzato da grande intensitÃƒ e colpi di scena, ha visto Errani e Vavassori mantenere la calma nei momenti decisivi, aggiudicandosi un tie-break combattutissimo nel primo set e chiudendo il secondo set con un break decisivo. La loro vittoria agli Us Open segna una pietra miliare per il tennis italiano e potrebbe aprire la strada a nuovi successi internazionali per il movimento azzurro. thesocialpost Tutta la gioia di Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori: "Momento speciale" - Sara errani e Andrea vavassori sono diventati la prima coppia italiana in grado di conquistare uno Slam in doppio misto. I due azzurri hanno realizzato l'obiettivo agli US Open battendo Taylor ... tennisworlditalia Sara Errani e Andrea Vavassori hanno vinto il torneo di doppio misto agli US Open: ÃƒÂ¨ la prima coppia di tennisti italiani a riuscirci - I tennisti italiani Andrea vavassori e Sara errani hanno vinto il torneo di doppio misto agli US Open, uno dei quattro tornei del Grande Slam, i tornei piÃƒÂ¹ importanti del tennis. Era la prima volta ch ... ilpost Tennis, Sara Errani nella storia: dopo lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢oro olimpico vince il doppio misto agli Us Open - Continua lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢estate dÃ¢â‚¬â„¢oro di Sara errani Dopo lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢oro alle Olimpiadi di Parigi in coppia con Jasmine Paolini, la tennista di Massa Lombarda conquista ... corriereromagna Video di Tendenza Video Errani Vavassori Video Errani Vavassori Â© Articolo pubblicato secondo le condizioni dell' Autore. author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | Glasgow Times
text:
Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit.
Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday.
Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected.
âš¡ We've now restored power to 46k customers #stormgerrit ðŸ  1.5k will be off overnight, we're giving help & advice.ðŸ‘· Teams are working tonight to clear debris hindering access to faults.â˜• Full details of vans serving hot meals from 9am tomorrow are at https://t.co/HSBcM400Fh pic.twitter.com/pnHIApyUvC
â€” Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (@ssencommunity) December 28, 2023
They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am.
Operations director Andy Smith said: â€œThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and Iâ€™m grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.â€
National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck.
Storm Gerrit strongest gusts. See story WEATHER Gerrit. Infographic PA Graphics. An editable version of this graphic is available if required. Please contact graphics@pamediagroup.com. Three men died after their 4Ã—4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a â€œlocalised tornadoâ€ in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook.
Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighboursâ€™ houses â€œare an absolute disasterâ€ with missing roofs and â€œsquishedâ€ cars.
Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said.
Screengrab taken from PA Video of a damaged gate in Stalybridge after the Tameside tornado (Richard McCarthy/PA) ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults.
Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day.
In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.
ðŸŒ¦ï¸ Blustery showers are possible on Friday morning, with these most likely in the north and west. Many of us will also see some sunshine and some places may stay dry.
ðŸŒ¬ï¸ Still windy in northern England and later Shetland, with gales possible, but otherwise somewhat less windy. pic.twitter.com/hInP8LNF2c
â€” Met Office (@metoffice) December 28, 2023
Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel.
Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal.
The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: â€œHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.â€

title: Ã‰puisÃ©es, les aides-soignantes en grÃ¨ve Ã  lâ€™hÃ´pital des Charpennes
text:
Les aides-soignantes de lâ€™hÃ´pital des Charpennes, Ã  Villeurbanne, Ã©taient en grÃ¨ve ce samedi. Elles dÃ©noncent un manque de personnel, des horaires dÃ©sorganisÃ©s et des conditions de travail quâ€™elles jugent insoutenables.
Dans ce service accueillant 25 patients souvent dÃ©pendants, le manque de personnel est criant. Certaines journÃ©es se dÃ©roulent avec seulement deux aides-soignantes le matin, voire une seule lâ€™aprÃ¨s-midi. Cette situation engendre une fatigue importante, multipliant les accidents de travail. Les grÃ©vistes demandent des effectifs renforcÃ©s, avec quatre aides-soignantes minimum le matin, pour offrir des soins adaptÃ©s et travailler dans de meilleures conditions.
Elles pointent aussi, comme le rapporte Le ProgrÃ¨s , des plannings modifiÃ©s sans concertation et des pressions pour faire des heures supplÃ©mentaires, rendant leur quotidien imprÃ©visible. Une situation qui, selon elles, met en pÃ©ril leur santÃ© et la qualitÃ© des soins prodiguÃ©s aux patients.
La direction minimise la portÃ©e du conflit, Ã©voquant un mouvement limitÃ© Ã  une quinzaine de personnes. Elle affirme dialoguer avec les reprÃ©sentants syndicaux pour trouver une issue, mais les grÃ©vistes jugent les mesures prises insuffisantes. Une pÃ©tition en ligne a Ã©tÃ© lancÃ©e pour soutenir leurs revendications.
Lire aussi : GrÃ¨ve des taxis : quelles zones Ã©viter lundi ?

author: Moira McCarthy
title: Banff's 'low season' deserves high praise for peak fun
text:
When you look at Banffâ€™s resume, itâ€™s clear why the famed spot in Alberta, Canada spot draws huge crowds in the high summer season.
History? Check. Banff National Park is Canadaâ€™s first national park and the third oldest national park in the world.
Pedigree? Check. Banff is rich in Canadian history and is a famed UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Good looks? Triple check. Itâ€™s home to soaring peaks, lush valleys and wildlife.
Things to do? Check. Downtown Banff, tucked into the base of the Canadian Rockies, is filled with great restaurants, bars, shopping and all kinds of entertainment, and the surroundings offer a myriad of outdoor and indoor activities.
Hereâ€™s the secret: Rather than plan a trip during that high season next summer, book for now. Because winter, Banffâ€™s low season, may just be the best season of all.
Itâ€™s not just that Banff is home to three unique ski areas (https://www.skibig3.com/), although knowing that youâ€™ll almost never find a winding lift line at any of those spots certainly motivates one to go; as does the wealth of great ski and ride schools throughout.
Itâ€™s not just that the crowds thin out, making it easy to secure reservations at even the most sought-after dining, entertainment and activity sites.
Itâ€™s that Banff in the winter is HQ for so many great things to do, both in that gorgeous natural setting, and at cozy indoor places.
As beautiful as those peaks and valleys are in the green of summer and fall, the white frosted gleam of winter is breathtaking. Banff might just be the prettiest ski town on the planet.
Getting to Banff is easy. Fly into Calgary International Airport and rent your car from there. (Youâ€™ll want a rental. You may not use it all the time, since the region has a robust shuttle system, but most find a car useful for a winter visit).
Youâ€™ll enter Banff National Park less than two hours from the airport (a straight-shot 80 mile drive). Air Canada has flights; you can also connect on an American-based airline, connecting via cities like Chicago and Minneapolis.
Youâ€™ll need to purchase a Park Pass to access Banff. You can buy it at the gate, or to check it off the list, purchase and print out ahead of time at https://www.banfflakelouise.com/. A one-week family pass is under $150; individual and day passes are available as well.
Home base is an easy match no matter your style. For upscale, you cannot miss with the Fairmont Banff Springs (https://www.fairmont.com/banff-springs/) or the famed Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise (https://www.fairmont.com/lake-louise/). For a comfortable in-town choice check out the Moose Hotel and Suites (https://moosehotelandsuites.com/). There are many more for every budget and style.
Then thereâ€™s Banff Sunshine, a ski resort where you can lodge overnight halfway up the mountain. Imagine being tucked in and cozy, close to the stars, for an entire winter night.
There are so many diverse activities and experiences unique to Banff â€“ a great spot to find and arrange them is https://www.banfflakelouise.com.
You can take on guided ice walking through the rocky gorges of Johnston Canyon and Grotto Canyon Led by a certified guide and equipped with crampons strapped to your boots, youâ€™ll follow frozen pathways through deep rock ravines carved out by centuries of moving water. Bonus: these areas are inaccessible in the high season.
You can book a dogsled tour through Banff that not only takes you to remote and beautiful spots, but teaches you about mushing.
You can ride the Banff Gondola, an immersive experience that celebrates and teaches about both the nature surrounding you and the Indigenous population that has inhabited that land for centuries.
You can soak and relax all day at the incredible Banff Spa, where youâ€™ll find spring-fed pools, massage and body treatments, great food and an incredible view.
You can ice skate (Lake Louise outside the Fairmont is a bucket list skating spot youâ€™ll treasure), go tubing on Mount Norquay (where you can also dine at the peak, looking down on the lovely town), take a sleigh ride across a giant frozen lake or through deep woods, savor unique cocktails and local sourced food in the smorgasbord of dining spots or just meander along the townâ€™s fun streets.
Winter may be dubbed Banffâ€™s low season, but for those who donâ€™t mind bundling up to find their joy, itâ€™s the highest level of fun.
Take in a sleigh ride across a frozen lake or through lush wintery woods at Lake Louise. (Photo Paul Zizka/Banff Lake Louise Tourism)
Banff is tucked up against the Canadian Rockies, surrounding the town with gorgeous views. (Photo Moira McCarthy)
